list_definition.definition: (the official residence of) an ambassador and his staff

list_ex_of_english: I have had some interest in the proper use of our embassies, especially in projecting our export drive.
We will all continue to work with our posts and embassies abroad to raise awareness of our import rules abroad.
The police have a duty, of course, to protect embassies and all foreign nationals who may be in our country.
British embassies in these countries have no difficulty in learning of the contents of most such reports and documents.
At the great embassies there was an ambassador, a counsellor and four or five secretaries.
Finally, there is the other non-statutory right to assistance abroad from embassies and consulates.
When two countries are involved, can the embassies not talk to each other?
Is there to be a night and a weekend emergency service in our embassies?
